website_summaries.verdict: The best wheelbarrow on the market today. You won't find better quality, versatility or dependability in another model.
pros: A patented design that provides optimal leverage for easier lifting and hauling
Features rugged steel and no-flat tires
Converts to a dolly and multi-functional mover
cons: Some consumers express that they wish the tray were wider, but its power and durability make up for this small concern

customer_reviews.title: good cart, so so condition
customer_reviews.text: I decided to keep this cart despite shipping(?) damage. It looks very useful for an older person with shoulder, back, and hand issues. I can no longer lift 80 lb without help. Assembly was easy except for the stiff cotter pins for the wheels. The deal price was right, and I'll probably beat it up myself, but still it is difficult to see how inside scratches and outside dents to the cart all occurred inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: Elspeth S

customer_reviews.title: Useless unless you live in a tiny yard...
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to have the coolest wheelbarrow in your neighborhood, buy one of these. If you're looking for a functional wheelbarrow to make you a more effective gardener, don't bother. I bought this mainly for fertilizer because I'm 60 years old and weigh 110 lbs. It's hard to handle a wheelbarrow across my mulched garden but this isn't much help. With a 50-pound bag, it was easy to move except I had to practically hunch in half to prevent it from falling out. It's waaaay smaller than it looks too, that bag pretty much filled it up. It will probably make a nice dolly but it's highly overpriced for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Extremely cheap construction. One of the adjustment knobs broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheap construction. One of the adjustment knobs broke the first time I used it. The bucket is too small for most jobs other than moving a flower plant or two around the yard. The "fork lift" part stuck and took me 5 minutes to fix the first time I used that part. In ended up buying a real wheel barrow the day after I received the WORX.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality item. Kid sized garden tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it 3 stars because it is not much of a wheel barrow. It works fine as a furniture dolly and the leaf collection attachment is handy, and the potted plant sling is handy if you have quality pots. As a wheel borrow though, it only holds about 8 shovel fulls of dirt. It also sits very low to the ground so there is a lot more bending over than a real wheel barrow involves. It is a quality item that I am sure will last many years. Even more so now that I still have to buy an actual wheel barrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too big; and not too small - Just right!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a larger, old-fashioned wheelbarrow with this Worx Aerocart. I added the wheelbarrow attachment which I keep on the unit most of the time. I haul rocks, dirt, bricks, limbs, dog food, BBQ charcoal and grandkids with this. Its uses are unlimited. I keep it in the front of the garage ready to go. I probably use it every other day. After hurricane Irma, I used it to bag up banana plant debris and other hurricane-damaged plant debris using the supplied bag attachment. Yes, it isn't "huge," but it's sized perfectly for my use. I'd rather make a few extra trips safely than over-load the unit or myself. Plus it stores nicely in an already full garage.
customer_reviews.author: 5galloncan

customer_reviews.title: Almost completely useless. When you lift the unit the downward slope ...
customer_reviews.text: Almost completely useless. When you lift the unit the downward slope and shape of the container just makes everything slide out the front. Forget about carrying any quantity of dirt or stone as you have to hunch over with it to keep the cargo from falling out. Its a pretty toy for little old gardeners, but not useful for any real work.
customer_reviews.author: Tin Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Nice solution  for homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it much yet. But so far this is a nice option for a small home owner. This is a great solution. I actually wanted to order a dolly or hand cart but when I saw this it was a great solution as I also had not purchased a wheel barrel for many of the other things that this product can be used for. I agree with the other reviews this is not a good option for someone who does construction or is a contractor. For homeowners this is a great option or thus far has been for me. Should anything change I will update the review but I am pleased as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I use it because I can't afford to replace it right now. I wish I had been here when my husband opened it and put it together because I would have told him to pack it right back up. It feels cheap. It's rattles as I walk it across the lawn. Dirt and branches always get stuck on the orange flip down dolly part. Plus, it feels like it's going to dump as I walk with it because it tilts downward so much. Really regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: pearslices

customer_reviews.title: well made hobby wheelbarrow - nice toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a toy, for use with light weight yard work. Not for serious yard work. It's well made, and the gimmicky attachments are a nice thought. Watch the infomercial and you'll see who the target audience is. If you're planning on humping 20 yards of mulch get a real wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: NSB

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy
customer_reviews.text: It's a cute little toy, your kids can play with it while you finish your yard work ... of course you'll have to buy a real wheelbarrow first, because this thing just ain't gonna get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: ETD

customer_reviews.title: I have only had this Aerocart for maybe two months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this Aerocart for maybe two months. The right wheel has already broken and ball bearings have fallen out. This was once a wheel barrow and unfortunately I am not stuck with just a barrow.
customer_reviews.author: Fowtown

customer_reviews.title: EXTEMELY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE - JOKE OF A "3 -YEAR" WARRANTY.....I WANT MY MONEY BACK AND AN APPOLOGY!
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is extremely poor! Three year warranty does NOT cover parts that wear? I have had my cart for less than 2 years and one of the wheel bearings broke (came out of "plastic" wheel). Cart is not functional at this point. Worx is happy to send me the replacement part $5 + $5 in postage. However when I indicated I would pay but file a complaint, the customer service agent actually hung up on me! Now that I am attempting to reach them via email, they have blocked my email address. Is THAT what customer service has come to these days?
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL L. JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Updating 11/24/19 i had this for awhile and so far so good only problem is the rubber grip on the handle which it's a easy fix just gotta get black electric tape to wrap around a handle. received my worx Aerocart 3 & 1 it was easy to put together length is 13"in wide & 31"in Long it came with a lot of attachments. Its well made and sturdy the wheels are hard plastic. I had to buy the front wheels separate other than that i give it five stars because I brought it to pick up trash before cutting grass.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE of the size. It is deceptively small compared to the pictures.
customer_reviews.text: The good is that it is very maneuverable, and it was incredibly easy to assemble. That said, if you are buying this as a wheelbarrow, it is incredibly small. It holds only about 1/4 of what any other wheelbarrow would hold. From the item description, "approximately 3 cubic feet volume capacity". Think about how little that really is, and then decide if it suits your needs. On the plus side, my wife loves how easy it is for her to handle when gardening, but for guys, who have to move a lot, I recommend the Gorilla Carts GOR10-16, which is huge, and absolutely awesome for larger jobs. Make sure you have the room to store it though.
customer_reviews.author: U4IC61

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool for any home owner
customer_reviews.text: I have used this cart for 3 of the many functions it performs. The dolly works great. Dual wheels for the wheelbarrow means twice the stability. Of course the depth and amount you can carry is less than a typical wheelbarrow. I don't see that as a reason not to buy. The trashbag holder works great as well. Like all these multipurpose tools, It's always about storing the optional equipment. It comes with several smaller pieces such as the trashbag holder, rock carrier inserts and straps.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews for this wheel barrow / cart. Yes, it is not a large capacity cart. Like others, I bought it for the ease on my back. The handle placement gives it leverage to lift heavy items, and push them around easily. I especially like the "large flower pot" lifter, as we have many plants in large pots, 50 to 100 lbs. I have also used the "dolly" feature, which works better than the narrow-wheeled dolly I Have, because of the wide tires rolling easily over grass. Very satisfied! My back appreciates it!
customer_reviews.author: I. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my husband and yo replace his broken down wheel barrow. He finally put it together last week. Omgoodness it's so very small! I had to laugh. Seriously not what was expected. It looked more like a toy. Not intended for big jobs at all. Now I need to find a new one again.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Dean

customer_reviews.title: Misaligned wheel axle - can't assemble
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this. I don't mind the size, it's just right for what I need. I started putting it together, and immediately, first step, found that one of the wheel axles had the hole drilled in the wrong place. So, it won't line up and I can't put one of the wheels on. First, that is VERY poor quality control. Second, I emailed customer service. They got back to me the next day and let me know that the part is backordered (wonder why?) and should be back in stock in 2-6 weeks. Spring will be over by then! So, I can't even use it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Line

customer_reviews.title: good quality item
customer_reviews.text: love the little Aerocart. perfect for what I bought it for. Hauling items from car out front to the back yard, moving dirt, potted plants, etc. I am getting older and need help carrying stuff. I put 2 bundles of roofing shingles in it, bag of cement, cinder blocks, etc. Not too big and cumbersome,, or heavy. Able to handle everything so far. Versatile, etc. Only drawback is that the folding tray for using as a dolly doesn't fold down completely and catches dirt when trying to dump the wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L Davis

customer_reviews.title: Unusable at this point. We got it in and ...
customer_reviews.text: Unusable at this point. We got it in and the hole in the wheel bolt doesn't line up with the hole in the axle so the pin won't go through. When we called aerocart about it, they said "you need to call Amazon". Classic pushing off to someone else even though it's supposed to be your product.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Smartest purchase EVER !
customer_reviews.text: I had seen a midnight infomercial on this wheelbarrow a while back and wanted one ever since. Finally my need for all of its' features was urgent so I bought it and I actually use this WORX wheelbarrow/ dolly EVERYDAY. Buying this amazing wheelbarrow is one of the smartest things I have ever done! I have a back injury, as so many people do nowadays, and this WORX wheelbarrow has saved me from extending the disability my injury has caused and using it has spared me additional pain. Thank you...although the wheelbarrow did arrive with some cracked parts ....the minimal damage hasn't negatively impacted the use of the wheelbarrow. Absolutely marvelous, and versatile just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Well made but completely useless.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in December and just now took it out of the box. Had I opened it immediately, I would have returned it. It is very well made - truly a nice piece of equipment, or it would be if you were a 7-year old child. I'm only 5'3" and if I hold the handles so I can push the cart without being stooped over, everything falls out. I might as well plant something in it and park it in the flowerbed. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lorinda S. Mckinnon

customer_reviews.title: Tough but very small!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, but it arrived at about half the size I anticipated. Takes twice as many trips now as my wheelbarrow did.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great but rocks get caught in the flip-down dolly support.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. However, my first use was to move 3/4 crushed stone from front to under back deck for weed control. The wheel barrow function was superb, however dumping the rock was somewhat problematic, the orange flip-down dolly support has enough play (>1/2”) such that the rock would get stuck between the dump and that support, so the bucket wouldn’t fully empty and over the course of the job the smaller rock fragments got jammed in the hinge of that, preventing it from opening at all. I was able to get it freed up after some hosing out, but should fit tighter and have something to prevent rock from getting in there and humming up that support.
customer_reviews.author: DJ&JC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice multi tool.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, took about 15 minutes and that included the unboxing. Even though the box looked like it got ran over by a semi all the pieces were there and only a couple minor scratches. Since it's a wheel barrow it will get scratched so I dont think it's that big of a deal. Love the multiple features, dolly, wheel Barrow, plant/tree/other lifter. Really cool multi tool. Glad I was able to score it during the deal of the day special. For less than $100 this thing was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Santina

customer_reviews.title: Versatile cart
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent mini wheel barrel/cart/utility device. I sued it to move some big rocks, over 200lbs, and it worked great. It does have composite wheels, which didn’t work great on damp gravel, but worked great on pavement. The flap that allows the cart to act as a hand truck cart did bend, but again the rocks were pretty heavy so it didn’t bother me to much. Also used for hauling topsoil and yard waste. A very practical multi use cart for landscaping back yard use. I might try to buy some rubber wheels for it that will take air to see if it improve performance in damp conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schmackle

customer_reviews.title: Not very big and lots of bending over and rusts easy
customer_reviews.text: I really expected a bigger barrel. You must bend over to get the handles and wheel it. You can put about one bag of mulch in it. I needed it to carry multiple bags to my back yard. The dolly part, well yes it turns into one but the flipped metal plate could maybe hold the plants but it’s awkward. Have to use it again to see if it’s really worth it. I’ve only had it a couple months and already rusted...
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Gudelski

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Really versatile yard cart/wheelbarrow, literally a "swiss army knife" for hauling/moving stuff around the yard. Very pleased with Worx products, I have a rechargeable string trimmer and blower too and they are great. My only complaint with this is the wheelbarrow capacity could be just a touch bigger, but other than that, it's about perfect. Great upgrade from the old cheap plastic "cart" I used to have that tipped over every time you tried to load it and was impossible to push.
customer_reviews.author: LLM

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this for gardening and moving.
customer_reviews.text: I like multi use products and this is one such item. It is narrower than most wheel barrows which is good if you need to move something in the house. Easy to lift and use. Easy to reconfigure for multiple uses. Tires don’t go flat. It’s pricey BUT it’s one thing doing the job of 8 so you save money AND lots of storage space! I like that! I have it leaning up on the side of the house and there is some rusting even though it’s protected.
customer_reviews.author: Deb-e C.

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable how it makes heavy things light!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have bought! It is indescribable how it distributes weight so that you are not needing much strength to move things around. Our first one was difficult to switch from wagon to dolly but we are hopeful that was a fluke. Wagon is deep but narrow. We mostly use it to move heavy items like 40 lbs of dog food or potted plants. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Judy B

customer_reviews.title: Best buy I've made in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This is what every homeowner needs. It's narrow enough to get through hallways and doorways, stable because of having two wheels, and works very well as both a wheelbarrow and a hand cart. Haul dirt, flip down the wheels and move a refrigerator, then flip out the arms and attach the and pickup large and heavy potted plants and move them easily. Incredibly versatile! The only down side is in dirt hauling capacity. It holds about half (4.5 cubic ft) of what a regular wheelbarrow does (10 cubic ft). A worthwhile trade off for all the other advantages it has.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Although this cart looks like it will be great for moving heavy objects in the yard, I really encouraged my husband to return it because the parts were simply NOT fitting together during assembly. He already had it in his mind that he was going to make it work, so he replaced the pin which holds the wheel in place with some wire he had, which is admits will not be as strong, but the pin and the hole where it was supposed to go just wouldn't line up after a couple of hours of trying to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Walker

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last a year under normal use
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile but since it’s only half the size (depth and width) of a standard size wheelbarrow, you are often limited to half the quantity of most tasks you do in a yard. What’s worse is that the quality of construction is below average. This means, the foam on the handles, the spring nuts holding the lip at the bottom among other things all wear very quickly making it pretty useless in short time. I’m talking about one planting season or at most one year, especially if you leave it outside. A valuable if expensive lesson learned. Don’t believe in half the things an infomercial touts. Silly me. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Love Great Products

customer_reviews.title: This is a TOY. It barely goes up to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a TOY. It barely goes up to my knees it sits so low to the ground. The main area can only hold about a 5 gallon bucket full and it sits so low everything spills out when you move it. Very poorly designed and simply does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D.

customer_reviews.title: It's a wonderful little cart
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful little cart. I'd give it 5 stars if it were larger. I'm keeping it because I love how I can easily move my potted plants. Also, I can see how this will come in handy as we age and are not able to move around larger amounts of soil, etc It's a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: ShellyM

customer_reviews.title: Nice little wheel barrow, can't lift rocks
customer_reviews.text: Definitely easier to maneuver than my 30 year old metal wheel barrow. For carrying light loads around the grass, this thing does great. Does not lift rocks like the advertisements claim. I tried to lift one rock (which a strong man was able to lift on his own, so I assumed it was small enough that a rock-lifting device could lift it.) Bent the arms immediately. Definitely not capable of lifting heavy items. If something is light enough for this thing to carry, it would also be light enough for you to carry it yourself...
customer_reviews.author: A. K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 89 year old mother for her chores about the yard. I will be bringing it to her home when Spring weather finally graces the PNW. In the mean time, I used this cart to move heavy items from our den after a pipe burst. It made light work of wet books, furniture,etc. It is not very big ,but it is so versatile that it is way more handy than a wheelbarrow or wagon. It exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: p.limb

customer_reviews.title: Makes working outside so easy! Especially with my severe osteo-arthritis in shoulders...
customer_reviews.text: I hate asking for help when I’m gardening or working outside. I want to be able to move bags of mulch, or rocks, or bags of leaves... or branches... or flagstones ... by myself. It’s an independence thing. This Aerocart lets me do that. It’s so light and so well balanced. I love it. We’ve had it two weeks and I’ve used it for something almost every day. Really. We bought the SnowPlow accessory for it which we’ll use in a couple months. If you have any shoulder problems - buy this, now! You’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: 6-StringAcoustic

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but strong and versitile
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how heavy this cart was going up and down hills, but it is made of some serious grade steel and has lots of it so that's an acceptable characteristic for me. Likewise it also has a small carrying capacity but that allows it to navigate into small places and not require much storage space, so that's another acceptable tradeoff. I've found it to be an excellent cart for residential horticulture. Barring steep slopes, you can usually easily get whatever you would usually have to carry from one place to another. I like mine so much I have ordered almost all the add-on accessories and use them all on one occasion or another.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Network Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse for small-framed people!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Already used this yard cart to lift & move large rocks! So thrilled to have a tool that suits my 5'2" frame. I don't struggle with this cart as I have with regular wheelbarrows and handtrucks. Already attached the plow head to clear the deck and ramps for my dogs once the snow hits!!! Very happy with my purchase despite some of the less than positive reviews. The directions aren't great but take your time and it's very intuitive. Pay attention to the weight limits for each additional tool. You'll be better than fine! Worx has definitely produced another winner here!
customer_reviews.author: Madd Maxx

customer_reviews.title: It's much smaller but it's great for moving stuff around the yard
customer_reviews.text: This thing does what it says. It is not a massive wheelbarrow. It's much smaller but it's great for moving stuff around the yard. The hand truck conversion is excellent. I moved my old dishwasher out and new one in all alone with no problem, up several flights of stairs. After reading several bad reviews I was ready to send it back before it got here but after using it for a few days it is staying put. Update-this thing keeps getting better and better!
customer_reviews.author: canefro

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I was looking for. My present wheelbarrow from Ace is becoming rickety, but I can still put 4 or more filled flower pots in it in order to move them around the yard or mix up a large batch of potting soil. This Worx won't do either. It's just too small for my purposes. Seems well made, easy to assemble and has a nice heft and feel to it. My husband has found it useful for some other things so it merits 4 stars but it's back to square one for this gardener.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good little wheel barrel
customer_reviews.text: The product was very easy to assemble. I was using it to move mulch and dirt around in no time. One con is the smaller bucket size, well noted by others, but I have a smaller property so it is fine for me. Also noted were the lower handles, which did seem a bit low for me at 5’10”, but not unusable, just need a little more bending at the knees. I loved the ability to fold it up and store away quickly without taking up much floor space. I can also foresee using the other hauling options as well in the future. Overall very good product.
customer_reviews.author: MR429

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend based on initial quality and customer service response
customer_reviews.text: received product and found one axle improperly drilled and would not fit. called customer service 3 times, waiting over 15 minutes each time. Left a call back number ( they said I wouldn't lose my place in the queue) Next day, still no call back. Finally redrilled the axle myself and finished assembly. seems to work as advertised. Would not recommend based on initial quality and customer service response.
customer_reviews.author: Holly A. Roe

customer_reviews.title: Came in dented and interior was scratched
customer_reviews.text: This came in today. I was a little disappointed there was a couple of dents in it and the interior was scratched up in a corner. I know it will get scratched and probably dented a bit with use, but coming in that way is why it only is getting 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Deb H.

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: This is everything it's advertised to be. My daughter and I love for moving heavy flower pots around, hauling dirt and moving heavy stuff around. As I said, it performs exactly like the mfg. says it does.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah T.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived dented and scratched, was missing one tie-screw and two of the side screw holes were not properly positioned and had to be slightly enlarged to make them fit. I wonder how durable the carton toon will be, since the bass plate is just riveted. I would have returned it but being so bulky felt it was too much of a hassle. As a wheelbarrow it is way too narrow to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: susanne

customer_reviews.title: Basically a Fancy Dolly
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this. Overpriced accessories, many of which are really kinda stupid, are not worth the price. I thought this might be good for firewood, but that accessory is overpriced and consists of a wide strap. You can't use it for firewood without the strap unless your split wood is wide enough to span the tongues. Mine aren't. Stick with a wheelbarrow and a basic dolly and your covered for a heck of a lot less money and wasted space for storing all the little accessories if you're rich enough to buy them all. The actual wheelbarrow part is useless as it is too tiny. This thing is for a tiny person with a tiny yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Assembly and defective parts 🙄🙄🙄
customer_reviews.text: I’m a lady who almost gave up trying to put this wagon and cart together. The instructions are HORRIBLE and some of the parts DID NOT IT properly esp. the handles for the Aerocart! The handles are rubbing against the tires so I had to turn them upside down to get any use out the cart. I put this together today 5.24.2019 and will be contacting the company about their horrid parts in hope of replacing the two defective ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sharah T. HortonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, versatile, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid champ, it never complained once spending a whole weekend carting loads of gravel around the property. It was an ease to move and dump. The only thing that could have made it better was if it was self loading. All that shoveling left me very sore, but that’s not the wheelbarrow fault it did it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Eggleston

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SLIGHT DRAWBACK
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the rating is because the one thing I bought it for was to move plants. The strap totally frayed on the third pot to be moved. Perhaps the is a stronger material for the strap to be made of. Other than that it is so GREAT love all the other features especially the wheelbarrow part and I use the dolly part with a bungee flat strap to move the plants around.This is definitely worth the money if you love landscaping and the outdoors. I'm sure it will come in handy as well for spring cleaning (under stove and frig ) inside as well.
customer_reviews.author: karen brown

customer_reviews.title: My Little Worx Horse
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I assembled it my 4' 10" wife began moving large rocks then her potted plants to the backyard. The items were a 2 man lift and she did it with this cart. I myself used it to move large quantities of pavers for our front yard landscaping project with amazing ease. Love the solid tires and that was the main reason I bought. Use it on the backyard project along side my Gorilla Cart. Easy to assemble and very versatile and it Worx!!
customer_reviews.author: ElJay

customer_reviews.title: I love it....but.....
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get my Worx, it works perfectly, easy to use. It’s almost the perfect cart! However, I’m extremely disappointed in the foam material they use for the handles is pathetic. They seemed to have put so much thought into the mechanics of it, but now the material. Most of my “foam” handles is gone but I’m ok with it. But for the money you pay for it, next time I’ll jist buy something different at my local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Regina King

customer_reviews.title: Sent two of same handles - Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well made , however they sent me 2 of same handles , instead of a left and right side - please see photo . I have to have one upside down ,can’t seem to contact company either. Worx itself won’t help and Amazon insists on replacing the entire item for just a handle - if disabled like I am , cannot move it until wheels attached. I would order directly from Worx- then no middleman if issues and only a $10 difference
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my WORX best Mother;s day gift last year
customer_reviews.text: best mother's day gift from my son ever! ever since I started to enjoy gardening and needed something to help me with all my tools so I can take it in something this wonderful cart could not be more perfect...Its not only light but so easy to handle even when I have it fully loaded.I can carry my plants with soil and tools all at one time.After I have done some planting I then do some weed picking and use my handy dandy cart straight to the recycle bin! then return my tools to the shed when I'm all done! truly ladies and gentlemen treat yourself and buy one of these wonderful carts that makes gardening much easier and enjoyable!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: We won't be buying another wheelbarrow for a long time...and if we do, it will be this one. This was easy to put together and the hauling features are awesome. It comes with a built-in dolly, a leaf bag holder and a handle design that does not force you to use your back. I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a new one!
customer_reviews.author: DM Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to other products.
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought the Aerocart due too the discount I received using my Amazon Prime Chase card points and deal of the day. Let me say it has worked magnificently as all around the house transport device. The only issue is I thought it was wider and deeper to hold more soil but it just added one extra trip or 2 to the dirt pile. I would recommend this to any homeowner who likes to do their own landscaping, gardening or hauling items around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: A bit awkward
customer_reviews.text: Pros: narrow, goes between garden planters and fence. Some versatile features are helpful. Cons: LONG, turning a tight corner is awkward. Dumping soil or gravel is almost impossible, as the tongue plate tries to open and soil/gravel gets caught and it doesn't close tight without cleaning out the debris and pushing it back into place. The pot lifter is OK but only IF your pot is NO WIDER that the width between the arms. I'll keep using it but will not replace with same item.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the reviews & disagree with the load complaint. My old style one wheeled barrow, you could not fill it up because it became too heavy & easily tipped over. Plus the Worx takes up less storage room in my garage. I love the multi ways it can be used, as a dolly or wheelbarrow, etc. Pricey but worth it. Will use the old barrel as a flower container!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I WOULD RECOMMEND TO SAY AWAY FROM THIS PROUCT UNTIL THE MANUFACTURE ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is too tiny. It should be at least a foot wider and two feet longer. Its way too tiny for the size of their competitors. I WOULD RECOMMEND TO SAY AWAY FROM THIS PROUCT UNTIL THE MANUFACTURE CHANGES THE DIMENSIONS
customer_reviews.author: Z. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Good item to buy.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Great product and easy to handle. Very light weight and like it so far. I would have preferred the dolly scoop to come off better. When dumping from the wheelbarrow, dirt and rocks get in the crack and jamb the dolly scoop. Making it hard to use. Also the handles are already cracking and its only a few months old. But I can always buy new ones. Overall, we love this wheelbarrow and my neighbors bought one too.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great item - must have
customer_reviews.text: My husband was going to buy an ordinary wheel barrow for working around the house. I saw this on Amazon and he liked the looks of it. He absolutely loves it now. It’s his go-to item for moving anything (including the steel panels for our hurricanes). It will not tip over, is easily maneuverable, and not overly heavy. He is very glad that he has this Worx rather than a clumsy wheel barrow.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: The product was easy to assemble (no tools required) and the design appears ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use as a dolly in place of an old skateboard that we have used for quite a while. The product was easy to assemble (no tools required) and the design appears well thought out. There are several attachments included that are easy to add/remove (yard waste bag holder, net for lifting heavy objects, etc). The wheel diameter is large enough to allow pulling the dolly up standard steps without rubbing the undercarriage on the stair edges which is nice. Overall a solid, versatile product that is well suited for a residential homeowner that doesn't want to purchase/store separate wheelbarrows, dollies, etc.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: This cart is AWESOME! It really does what it says
customer_reviews.text: This cart is AWESOME! It really does what it says. And yes, it does not have the full capacity of a typical wheel barrow. I have read reviews of people giving low reviews because of that. Um... this cart give the exact amount that can fit in the barrow. It is a smaller amount... but it still hold enough. Plus it has 2 wheels, works as a good hand truck. The bag holder is so helpful, and yes, you can pick up bigger rocks and planters with the attached lift accessories. And... you don't have to put it all together when it is delivered. All you have to do is put the handles on.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Gimmick?
customer_reviews.text: I watched the TV demo-commercials. When I finally purchased the Yard-cart, I had to remove the U-bar that is used for lifting objects because it kept flopping down; it was very irritating. The cart is easy to push but not very durable. I loaded some oversized rocks and noticed numerous dents in the base of the cart. Just a simple toss left major size dents. I'll update this review if needed. For now, it does the job, but the infomercials were somewhat deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this cart
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this cart - we've used it almost daily since gardening started about a month ago. We bought the wagon kit to convert to a wagon when needed, and we've used the dolly feature to move a heavy plant pot. In all cases, it handled the work like a boss. SUPER versatile tool for backyard projects and gardening, and we are extremely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: batjen

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great about this wheel barrow except the size
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this wheel barrow except the size. The images are quite deceiving, they never show the bucket head-on, only from an angle and they do not disclose the volume or dimensions of the bucket in the description. While the bucket is deep, it is extremely narrow. Everything else about it great. It is extremely well built and the design with the fold out legs, ergonomic handles and great center-of-gravity makes it easy to use and maneuver. Expect to make double the trips than your traditional wheel barrow, but the added features of a dolly, extended arm lift, etc. make it pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Architechsan

customer_reviews.title: Very shallow
customer_reviews.text: I like it ok. It does the job. It’s easy to put together and ok to maneuver around but it’s very shallow. You won’t get as much as you would in a standard wheelbarrow. It’s good for the smallest of projects. I liked the ease of use and why I bought this one but it will scratch easy the first time you use it and will hold half of what you may be used to with standard wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Moriko

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the size. If you have anything that requires hauling more than 7 or 8 gallons of material, this is probably not the wheelbarrow for you. Also, if you're taller than 5'6, it's probably going to be too short to use effectively as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT'S HALF THE SIZE OF A 6 CUBIC FOOT ONE.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE TIME TO MAKE SURE THAT YOU READ WHAT YOU'RE GETTING. I DO LIKE THE IDEA AND EVERYTHING ELSE, HOWEVER I WASN'T EXPECTING A MINIATURE WHEELBARROW. I WAS A LITTLE DISAPPOINTED WHEN I SAW IT BECAUSE I THOUGHT I WAS GETTING A 6 CUBIC FOOT WHEELBARROW AND WHAT I RECEIVED IS THE SONS, NOT THE DADS. I WOULD HAVE SPENT A LITTLE MORE MONEY FOR THE DADS SIZE TRUTHFULLY BUT I GUESS IT IS WHAT IT IS AND IT IS A GOOD ONE ONLY HALF THE SIZE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every woman should have one!
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest thing for a woman to have around the house and yard. I do not need any help to move large and or heavy objects. It is narrow enough to get through the hallway and around rooms. and worked great to move the contents of a closet to another closet, and as a furniture dolly. I use it in the yard, garage and house. Very, very handy! The ONLY problem with it, is the wheels do not steer, so turning tight corners takes maneuvering. Doable, just have to learn the dimensions so you can make the tight turns. Yes, I recommend buying this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Good design, so-so execution.
customer_reviews.text: Innovative, multi-purpose device. There are a few opportunities to pinch your fingers in some of the folding parts to a little caution is wise. foam on the handlebars is not nearly sturdy enough, already showing bad wear after just 6 uses. I do store it indoors. Wheels good, body/tub good, nice balance, just not as rugged as I would have liked. Already missing one rubber "foot" from the stand legs in the front. The legs are not well-braced at all. Good design, so-so execution.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: The weight distribution is not as described. Moving heavy loads are not easier than my Gorilla cart; load is smaller than Gorilla cart and harder to move and maneuver. Might be ok for light garden work, but way overpriced for that. A disappointment, I would return, but I already cut up the box, I will write it off to falling for advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Moffett

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Have had this a year now and have used it for several projects. We have moved rocks, from pebbles in a bag to larger hard to carry rocks, moved giant plants from a deck, down the stairs into the garage. It's carried mulch, dirt and sod. So far no complaints at all. Seems to be an item that actually lives up to the hype! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lakenpath

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose home and yard took.
customer_reviews.text: Had a neighbor who had one of these and highly recommended it. It actually turned out to be great for our needs. Have used it as a hand truck lifting some pretty heavy items and it worked great. Also have used the wheel barrow function which worked great without falling over when weight shifted. The wheel barrow capacity is smaller than a regular size but still handled a good amount of top soil. Looking forward to using the other functions.
customer_reviews.author: Airnot

customer_reviews.title: Multi-role tool
customer_reviews.text: Works very well as a wheelbarrow, although the capacity of the tub is not as much as a traditional wheelbarrow. The wide track makes it very stable. The weight of the loaded material is just right not to make the load too heavy. It is equally effective as a basic dolly. Again, the wide track makes it very stable. I bought the garden cart conversion kit. It works quite well for this purpose too. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sap

customer_reviews.title: WORKZ Aerocart, Wagon and Wheelbarrel:
customer_reviews.text: This yard tool is very balanced and well worth the wait and money paid. I prefer smaller styled Wheel Barrel type tools. This was a perfect replacement for my old small seventies wheel barrel. The many features or options give this tool an edge over many others available. Living in the desert and moving dirt, cement, bricks, plants and many other things is easier with this device. It is also good and worker friendly for the wife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband put it together upon receipt of this wheelbarrow. He is difficult to impress but he is very pleased how well this wheelbarrow is made and designed. He came inside the house after assembling and was happy to tell me how easy it was to put together. The cart is narrower than expected but we both like it very much. I'm sure it's going to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: CautiousShopper

customer_reviews.title: It's great for yardwork in the suburbs
customer_reviews.text: As a garden cart, it's not built for hauling enormous loads of material. It's great for yardwork in the suburbs, it's versatile, it's maneuverable, and it keeps the load balanced reasonably well over the axle. I've used it so far for moving roughly 2 cubic yards of mulch, another cubic yard or two of clay-heavy dirt, 2 cubic yards of crushed stone, and a few dozen retaining wall blocks. It's held up beautifully and looks like it should last through more summers of yardwork.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed damaged and missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: We received this product, it was missing its handles a wheel pin and a few other parts. Besides the fact that it had a huge dent in the wheelbarrow section itself. When we tried to exchange it it was a lot more expensive than what we paid so we just returned it to receive a refund. It was very disappointing since it was a Father's Day gift that had to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is super easy to assemble. As others have recommended I used a little grease here and there on the wear points axles, pins etc. to add years to it's usability. It doesn't have a good turning radius so avoid tight spots if possible our plan a work around. I will be using it when I move in a month or so. It should make that a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Tasselhoff

customer_reviews.title: terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I noticed its not being advertised anymore. Probably because its a rip off. It was very small came to me dented up and missing pieces over priced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: vikesupporter

customer_reviews.title: WORX Aerocart Is Great
customer_reviews.text: I am older and cannot push a regular wheelbarrow anymore. It is too heavy and hard to maneuver. The Aerocart is strong but not heavy and is so easy to push around. I haven't used thr attachments yet but really like the way I can load the Aerocart and push it to my destination without losing control of it and turning everything out on the ground. I also have a bad problem with sciatica but this wheelbarrow doesn't hurt my back and arms at all.
customer_reviews.author: Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Real Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small wheel barrow and this ended being longer than I wanted. The product: It arrived as scheduled, took 15 minutes (read directions) to put together, the quality of the product is excellent. I am just looking for something smaller, if this meets your requirements (it is also multi functional) I would not hesitate recommending this.
customer_reviews.author: Lon Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but instructions were worthless
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much had to figure out assembly myself. Instructions were terrible. Used it to bring a dresser up a flight of stairs. Dresser fell off twice. Luckily I was holding it or it would have slipped back down the stairs. In fairness, I haven't used it for anything else yet or tried the other attachments. It does look like will be great for smaller jobs. Overall, I am not upset with this purchase, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: BreAna Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little wheelbarrow. And it is little. That was a surprise. But don't let its size confuse you. We've been working this thing on all manner of projects and it is a keeper. From moving gravel to carting the big bags of dog food into the kennel, this wheelbarrow does it all and is very easy to handle. I plan to buy another one as a gift for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Oleary

customer_reviews.title: remarkable
customer_reviews.text: As described and very useful. Fits through house doorways OK and through the garden gates. It is not presumed to replace a full size wheel barrow yet does the work of hauling coal bags, manure bags or gardening weeds easily. Its a decent dolly and its adjust-ability is remarkable. Moved the water heater with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lift, and carry heavy loads.
customer_reviews.text: When unit was unboxed found broken plastic pin retainers for handles. Other than that I find this to be a help for yard work at my age ( approaching 70 ). Even with wheelbarrow full of dirt or yard mulch I found it easy to move and dump. Been wanting one for years, finally bought one and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: John Ray

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first week
customer_reviews.text: Not big enough or strong enough. The picture of the unit lifting the bolder in joke. It must be a foam rubber rock. Mine broke lifting a plant the first time it was in that configuration. While the plant was likely over the 80lbs limit, the unit could be much better if higher strength materials were used. The upside is it is easy to store if you do not have enough space for a full size wheelbarrow, just don't try to get full sized work out of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't able to assemble due to a defected part. I had to drill the hole so that screw could go in and fit. TOO SMALL for adult. Good idea for wheelbarrow with dolly feature, but not so practical.
customer_reviews.author: Ho Kim

customer_reviews.title: Way too small. Too low to the ground, ...
customer_reviews.text: Way too small. Too low to the ground, missing parts. Called customer service VERY RUDE, I am returning .
customer_reviews.author: Treez

customer_reviews.title: This multipurpose utility cart was very useful to me this last summer
customer_reviews.text: This multipurpose utility cart was very useful to me this last summer. It carries lighter loads than a wheelbarrow, so my wife can handle it with ease. As an upright truck, I can bag yard waste directly into the bag using the provided bag holder attachment. The only problem I had with it is that some parts are held in place by spring clip pins that have come loose or out during use, requiring a search of the work area. Other than this, I'm satisfied with the cart and it's features.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Opal

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small garden.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to have all the accessories for your small garden, this is the workhorse for you. I would use this to have all the tools ready, it is not meant to be a heavy duty item. This is perfect for getting into the tight spaces and getting your gardening done more efficiently. Buy some accessories, they make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: ZeframCochran

customer_reviews.title: High Quality one month in
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small very sturdy yard cart to haul granite dust around our relatively inaccessible yard. The hard wheels, the small very sturdy steel tub are able to haul a good load around without getting bogged down on slopes. The handles are long and wide enough for me to haul the cart backwards - a good thing. Have not used any of the gadgets: rock lifter, plant lifter, etc. but they look well designed and built too.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: The major draw for this piece of equipment is the versatility. There's a spring latch that holds the back legs in place, either retracted or extended, which broke the first day. I used it to extend the legs so that the cart sat horizontally and when I pulled it again to retract them, the knob came off and there's no way to put it back on. Now the legs are permanently extended which negates the versatility of use that I bought this for. Amazon did work with me on a partial refund but that doesn't fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: dlclarke

customer_reviews.title: great overall cart
customer_reviews.text: great overall cart, especially the plant pot mover attachment, which work grat and helped me move the plants outdoors indoor in approx. 125 minutes vs. previously having to lug these for half a day. My yardman wants one too...
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Luedi

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: The plant moving devise is not as easy to use as I had hoped it would be but it does work. I used it on large, heavy. tapered pots and got the job done but with a little more struggle than I had hoped. The handles are closer to the ground than a normal wheelbarrow. This meant leaning over to use it. I am 5'5". I could have gotten better leverage to lift the pots if the handles were higher up.
customer_reviews.author: Net shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. I wanted to use it to clean up alpaca poop in my pastures and it is very difficult to use. It does not go over terrain very well, is too low to the ground and is generally not very useful for I wanted to use it for. Will keep it and find some use for it, but would not recommend it for anything but very light work and for use by a very short person,
customer_reviews.author: Donna Lamarche

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, lots of features
customer_reviews.text: The item was delivered as expected but the item inside the box had some scrapes and dings inside the metal cart. That said, easy to put together and lots of features. Wish the tires were able to handle more weight for larger items, but this is most likely replace my existing wheelbarrow!
customer_reviews.author: Phil C

customer_reviews.title: Bought specifically for our new home to do yard work ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically for our new home to do yard work. The first day of using it the pin for the wheels came out 3 times! The 2nd day resulted in a smaller bolt and it's pin holding 1 of the arms to come off (note, this piece of the cart came already installed!). We found the bolt but not the pin. Unable to provide seller feedback via Amazon so hopefully Amazon Customer Service and/or Seller will contact me for options.
customer_reviews.author: DebP

product_meta.title: WORX Aerocart 8-in-1 Wheelbarrow / Yard Cart / Dolly
product_meta.description:
Style:Aerocart only

The Aerocart specializes in making enormous jobs manageable. Hold up to 300 lbs and move it from one place to the next with much less effort than a normal wheelbarrow would require. It’s an 8-function yard cart, with available accessories to add even more functionality. If you would generally need a stronger person to help you do landscaping projects, like moving rocks or large potted plants, the Aerocart has come to your rescue. Its innovative construction gets under the load and lets you lean it back and then wheel it around the yard like you’re some kind of gardening superhero.



Tehcnical specifications:



In wheelbarrow mode: 19” high x 22” wide x 58” long.

 

In dolly mode: 58” high x 22” wide x 19” deep.



In extended dolly mode: 58” high x 22” wide x 34” deep.
feature_bullets: Instantly converts between a lightweight wheelbarrows, yard cart, bag holder, dolly, extended dolly, cylinder carrier, rock/plant mover & trailer tote.
Aerocart's dimensions (wheelbarrow mode): 19” H x 22” W x 58” L. Aerocart's weight: 41 pounds
Dolly load capacity: 300 pounds; Wheelbarrow weight capacity: 300 pounds; Wheelbarrow volume capacity: 3 feet
Wagon seat capacity: 300 pounds; Wagon kit weight: 16.3 pounds
Turbo Lift design makes a 200 pounds wheelbarrow load feel like 17 pounds
Easy assembly required. Instantly converts between a lightweight wheelbarrow, yard cart, bag holder, dolly, extended dolly, cylinder carrier, rock/plant mover & trailer tote.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,653 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
